sentence: U.S. markets dropped on Tuesday, snapping recent winning streaks on trade and geopolitical jitters and as economic data lifted inflation expectations, sending bond yields spiking.
With a slate of earnings due this week from top retailers, disappointing results from Dow Jones Industrial Average component Home Depot ( HD ) had the measures in retreat from the opening bell.
On the S&P 500, all 11 sectors were in the red, with real estate, health care and utilities sliding the most.
The Nasdaq was dented by tech losses while the CBOE Volatility Index surged.
